w:r.w:t: : An electrode is an electrical conductor that is used to provide current to the electrolyte. The two types of electrodes, cathode and anode, attract different charges. The cathode attracts the positively-charged cations and the anode attracts the negatively-charged anions.
Which among the following chemical effects can be observed
electric current is passed through a particular conducting solution containing electrodes?

When an electric current is passed through a particular conducting solution containing electrodes certain chemical effects are observed. Gas bubbles will be formed at the electrodes. Moreover, metal deposition can also be observed at the electrodes and the solutionâ€™s colour will change.
